title: Associate Insurance Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NEEA (Brampton, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Telephone  interview was done and described me all  the the terms and procedure of my position .
And further asked me various questions which were behavioural questions and I answered them

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NEEA
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR via email to set up a phone interview. I was told it wouldn’t be more than 15 minutes and we were to discuss my background and why I’m interested in the position. From the start, the interview was very terse. Although I attempted to engage the HR rep in pleasantries and prompt some sort of verbal exchange following my responses, it never happened. The questions themselves were highly specific, which caught me off guard especially after I was lead to believe this was a more informal discussion. I followed up with a thank you email immediately afterwards and heard nothing from HR until I got an automated ‘thank you for your time’ email 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Describe a recent time where you had to gain a manager’s buy in for a new proposal, and what was the process like?

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NEEA (Portland, OR) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not your typical phone screen - we really got into some details that gave me a feel for the job, the boss, the market, and the organization. I was on the fence about this being a good fit and the in-depth phone screen helped me make a decision.
Interview Questions: Asked a number of targeted yet open-ended questions about my relevant experience, particularly to highlight ways that this position differs from typical.

title: Planning Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NEEA (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR, then in person interview with manager. After two interviews, they didn't even contact me with an answer. It took me reaching out via phone, email, and Linkedin to finally hear a decision from the manager. I still haven't heard back from HR. Their communication was abysmal.
Interview Questions: What modeling experience do you have?

title: Accounting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NEEA (Portland, OR) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Grueling. For a 32+hour per week position, I was put through a 15-minute phone screening, followed by a 45-minute one-on-one interview. 
Next in the process was a 55-minute "panel" interview which involved responding to four persons reading off a form of questions. At one point, I glanced at one person and noticed he was doodling.
Once that concluded, I met with the director, who clearly seemed disinterested, for 40 minutes.
After one week of not hearing from the organization, I learned secondhand that the position was filled.
Some respect, especially after making the effort to send each person a "Thank You" card, including the receptionist.
An enormous waste of my time, and to not even have the professional courtesy from a business stand point to at least inform me is outrageous and inexcusable.
Interview Questions: There were a couple, one that stands out regarding whether I implemented a company policy.
